channel.title: Whalesbook Financial News
channel.description: Latest Indian and global financial market news

item.title: Ahluwalia Contracts: Analyst Sees Buy Potential Despite NCR Headwinds
item.description: ICICI Securities upgraded Ahluwalia Contracts India Limited to 'Buy', citing a significant stock price correction and a robust order backlog that provides strong future revenue visibility. The upgrade comes despite a Q3FY26 performance that fell short of estimates, primarily due to construction bans in the NCR region impacting execution. The company's year-to-date order inflow has surpassed its full-year guidance, bolstering confidence in its long-term growth trajectory.

item.title: Apollo Hospitals Beats Q3; High Valuation, Sector Risks Loom
item.description: Apollo Hospitals Enterprises delivered a robust Q3 FY26 with revenue up 17% and net profit surging 35%, driven by its core hospital segment and growing Healthco division. Despite these strong operational beats, the company's elevated P/E ratio, lower consolidated margins compared to specialized peers, and past ethical concerns present underlying risks that may temper immediate investor enthusiasm.

item.title: Aurobindo Pharma: Growth Prospects Clouded by Regulatory Scrutiny
item.description: Aurobindo Pharma posted stronger-than-expected Q3 FY26 revenue and EBITDA, bolstered by European and ARV segment growth. The company continues to expand its US generics pipeline with 879 ANDA filings. However, recent US FDA inspections at its Eugia III and Unit VII facilities yielded multiple procedural observations, adding to existing regulatory concerns. While analysts maintain 'Buy' ratings, the stock's reaction post-earnings and the sector's US market challenges warrant a closer look at valuation versus inherent risks.

item.title: Telangana's $3T Vision: Ambitious Goals Face Reality Check
item.description: Telangana has unveiled 'Telangana Rising 2047,' targeting a $3 trillion economy by 2047, driven by life sciences and Global Capability Centres (GCCs). The state aims for significant investment and job creation, leveraging its position as a leading life sciences hub with over 250 USFDA-approved sites. However, achieving these ambitious economic targets requires substantial acceleration beyond current growth trajectories and faces intense domestic and global competition.

item.title: India Fines Intel $3.3M for Warranty Abuse, Stifling Competition
item.description: India's Competition Commission levied a Rs 27.38 crore ($3.3 million USD) penalty on Intel Corporation for abusing its dominant market position. The penalty stems from an "India-Specific Warranty Policy" enforced between April 2016 and April 2024, which denied warranty services to Indian consumers purchasing genuine Intel processors through parallel importers. This practice is found to have harmed competition and limited consumer choice in a significant market for Intel.

item.title: India's Strategic Pivot: Navigating Global Volatility from a Position of Strength
item.description: External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar highlighted India's assertive international engagement from a position of strength, driven by its 'Atmanirbhar Bharat' initiative. Amidst a volatile global order characterized by the 'weaponization' of production and finance, India is forging strategic partnerships and investing in key sectors like semiconductors, AI, and defense. This proactive stance aims to enhance economic security, foster domestic capabilities, and position India as a stable anchor in an increasingly unpredictable world, contrasting with the fragile outlook for global growth.

item.title: Karnataka Gig Fee Squeezes Platform Margins
item.description: Karnataka's government has enacted a 1% welfare fee on gig and platform-based services, effective February 13, 2026. This mandate, designed to fund a worker welfare fund, imposes collection and remittance responsibilities on platforms like Zomato and Swiggy. While intended to benefit gig workers, the levy introduces a new layer of operational complexity and financial strain on aggregators already navigating a competitive and margin-sensitive market. The capped structure across various service categories adds further complexity, forcing platforms to re-evaluate their cost structures and pricing strategies.

item.title: Exponent One Unlocks Commercial EV Growth with Data-Driven Finance
item.description: Exponent Energy has launched Exponent One, a dedicated fintech and asset management venture aimed at overcoming financing hurdles for commercial electric vehicles (CEVs). The new entity, led by Sandeep Divakaran, leverages Exponent Energy's proprietary real-time vehicle and energy data to build adaptive lending models. These models will align loan repayments with the variable earnings of commercial operators, a significant departure from traditional fixed EMI structures that have hindered CEV adoption. Exponent One has secured $2 million in pre-seed funding from AdvantEdge Founders to support its initial rollout and expansion.

item.title: India's Solar Glut: Policy-Fueled Boom Faces Consolidation
item.description: India's ambitious solar manufacturing expansion, driven by government incentives, has resulted in a severe structural glut, with capacity far exceeding domestic demand. Module utilization has plummeted to around 40%. While leading firms like Waaree Energies and Adani Solar hold significant market share, the sector faces intense cost pressures, the obsolescence of older technologies like MonoPERC, and reduced export competitiveness due to US tariffs. Analysts predict significant consolidation as smaller players struggle to keep pace with technological advancements and maintain profitability, leading to an inevitable reshaping of the industry.

item.title: Sterling Powergensys Faces Delay in Q3 Results Filing
item.description: Sterling Powergensys Limited has informed the stock exchange (BSE) about a delay in submitting its unaudited financial results for the quarter ended December 31, 2025. The company has missed the regulatory deadline, raising concerns among investors about transparency and compliance.

item.title: Shriram Finance Gets Top AAA Rating, MUFG Eyes 20% Stake
item.description: Shriram Finance Limited has secured its highest 'CARE AAA' credit rating for long-term debt, with a 'CARE A1+' for bank facilities. The rating reflects strong market leadership and diversification. A key development is MUFG's proposed 20% equity stake acquisition, pending approvals. The company also reported robust financial performance, with AUM crossing ₹2.9 lakh crore and adjusted PAT growing in FY25.

item.title: Mahindra & Mahindra Posts Stellar 47% Profit Jump on Auto, Farm Strength
item.description: Mahindra & Mahindra Ltd. (M&M) announced a powerful Q3 FY26, with reported PAT surging 47% YoY to ₹2,025 crore, driven by exceptional performance in its Auto and Farm Equipment segments. Revenue grew 26% YoY. The company highlighted plans for an IPO of its Last Mile Mobility business and expressed optimism about India's long-term economic prospects.

item.title: Japanese Giant Aica Kogyo Becomes Stylam Promoter, Plans Big Open Offer
item.description: Japanese firm Aica Kogyo Company, Limited has significantly boosted its stake in Stylam Industries Limited to 27.12%, officially becoming a promoter. This move follows open market transactions and share purchase agreements, culminating in a tranche closing on February 17, 2026. Aica Kogyo also announced plans for an open offer to acquire an additional 26% of Stylam's shares, signalling a major strategic shift and potential change in control for the Indian laminate manufacturer.

item.title: Japanese Firm Aica Kogyo to Buy 26% More Stylam Ind. Shares via Open Offer
item.description: Japanese firm Aica Kogyo Company, Limited has acquired a 27.12% stake in Stylam Industries Limited, triggering a mandatory open offer. This move signals Aica Kogyo's intention to gain control of the Indian decorative laminates manufacturer, offering public shareholders an exit route.

item.title: Hind Rectifiers Posts Strong Q3 Growth, Announces 1:1 Bonus Share
item.description: Hind Rectifiers Limited reported a robust Q3 FY26 with revenue up 64.2% YoY to ₹277.4 Cr. The company announced a 1:1 bonus share issue and is set for future margin improvements driven by backward integration and new CEO's strategy.

item.title: TBO Tek Eyes Growth with Classic Vacations, But Regulatory Cloud Looms
item.description: TBO Tek reported robust Q3 FY26 results with revenue surging 86% year-on-year, significantly boosted by its acquisition of Classic Vacations. While Gross Transaction Value (GTV) and Adjusted EBITDA also saw strong double-digit growth, the company faces a significant regulatory challenge as the Reserve Bank of India denied approval for certain international payments, leading to ongoing proceedings. Increased finance costs are also noted due to the acquisition.

item.title: Aequs Invests ₹230 Cr in Subsidiary, Uses IPO Funds for Loans & Capex
item.description: Aequs Limited is injecting ₹2,307.12 million (₹230.71 Crore) into its wholly owned subsidiary, AeroStructures Manufacturing India Private Limited (ASMIPL), through a rights issue. This strategic move utilizes proceeds from its Initial Public Offering (IPO) and is earmarked for repaying bank loans and funding capital expenditure, signaling a focus on strengthening financial health and operational capabilities.

item.title: Z-Tech Wins Mega Park Contract: Financial Structure Under Scrutiny
item.description: Z-Tech (India) Limited has secured its largest contract for the 'Krishna-Lok' Waste-to-Wonder theme park in Uttar Pradesh, valued at over ₹19 crore. The project, spanning 34 acres, utilizes a 20-year revenue-sharing model where the company contributes 10% of the capital cost. While celebrated, this deal prompts an examination of Z-Tech's financial strategy, its alignment with core businesses, and its current market valuation which appears stretched compared to sector peers.

item.title: India Targets $200B AI Data Center Hub Amidst Global Race
item.description: India is aggressively pursuing a $200 billion investment target for data centers to establish itself as a global AI hub. This ambition is fueled by substantial commitments from tech giants, including Google's $15 billion, Microsoft's $17.5 billion, and Amazon's $35 billion, aimed at bolstering AI infrastructure and services. The government is implementing supportive policies, such as tax holidays and shared computing facilities, to attract capital and foster AI development. The strategy emphasizes building accessible AI infrastructure, developing sovereign models, and nurturing a skilled workforce, positioning India as a key player in the global AI race while navigating innovation with necessary safeguards.

item.title: SBI Midcap Momentum ETF: High-Risk Passive Bet
item.description: SBI Mutual Fund has introduced the SBI Nifty Midcap150 Momentum 50 ETF, an open-ended passive fund designed to track the Nifty Midcap 150 Momentum 50 Index. The New Fund Offer (NFO) is open until February 24, 2026. While employing a passive strategy to mirror index returns, the fund is classified as "very high risk" according to its Scheme Information Document. The fund will primarily invest 95-100% in index stocks, with up to 5% in debt instruments. The minimum investment is ₹5,000, with no exit load.

item.title: Tata Motors PV's Rally Masks JLR's Cash Burn & Margin Strain
item.description: Tata Motors' Passenger Vehicle (PV) division is experiencing a strong rally, buoyed by robust domestic demand and recent product launches. However, this positive momentum is overshadowed by the persistent financial pressures at Jaguar Land Rover (JLR), characterized by low EBIT margins, significant free cash outflows, and substantial ongoing investment requirements. The stark contrast in segment performance and valuation metrics, when compared to domestic peers like Maruti Suzuki and Mahindra & Mahindra, raises questions about the sustainability of the current stock performance and the true cost of JLR's turnaround.

item.title: GR Infraprojects Secures ₹1,898 Cr Railway Project in Madhya Pradesh
item.description: G R Infraprojects Limited (GRINFRA) has been awarded a significant Letter of Acceptance (LOA) from West Central Railway for an EPC project valued at ₹1897.51 Crores. The project involves constructing a new railway line between Bahari and Gondawali stations in Madhya Pradesh, including extensive earthwork, bridges, viaducts, tunnels, and track work. The project has a completion timeline of 900 days.

item.title: NPCI's FiMI AI: Scaling UPI Support Amidst Data Tsunami
item.description: The National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) has unveiled FiMI (Finance Model for India), an in-house developed AI language model designed for its digital payments ecosystem. This specialized AI aims to streamline complex payment workflows, including UPI transactions and dispute resolution. FiMI currently powers the UPI Help Assistant, with plans to expand multilingual support beyond English, Hindi, Telugu, and Bengali. The initiative seeks to improve operational efficiency and user experience as India's digital payment market, particularly UPI, continues its exponential growth trajectory, projecting a market value of $10 trillion by 2026. However, challenges remain in scaling advanced AI capabilities to meet diverse linguistic needs and navigating regulatory frameworks.

item.title: Defence Stocks Diverge: HAL, BEL Lead as Shipbuilders Eye Subsidized Growth
item.description: Defence stocks are experiencing a bifurcated rally, with Hindustan Aeronautics Ltd (HAL) and Bharat Electronics Ltd (BEL) showing strong momentum driven by robust order books and significant government allocations for defence modernization. These leading aerospace and avionics firms exhibit relative strength compared to the broader Nifty Defence Index. Conversely, the shipbuilding segment, including Cochin Shipyard Ltd (CSL), Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders Ltd (MDL), and Garden Reach Shipbuilders & Engineers Ltd (GRSE), is showing early recovery signs, heavily reliant on new government financial assistance schemes and large international orders, rather than broad-based investor participation. While government budgets are supportive, the shipbuilding segment's path to sustained growth remains contingent on external factors and wider market interest.

item.title: Grid Accelerator Unlocks Private Capital for India's Power Future
item.description: The Global Energy Alliance for People and Planet's India Grids of the Future Accelerator, launched with a $25 million commitment, aims to unlock $100 million by 2030 using blended finance. This initiative targets modernization of India's power distribution, integration of renewables and storage, and digitalization of grids to meet escalating demand and ensure energy abundance and reliability. It designates Delhi and Rajasthan utilities as initial 'champion utilities'.

item.title: Maruti Suzuki Launches e VITARA Electric SUV, Entering India's EV Race
item.description: Maruti Suzuki India Limited has officially begun sales for its new Battery Electric Vehicle (BEV), the e VITARA. This launch marks a significant entry into India's rapidly expanding electric mobility sector. Customers can book the SUV for ₹21,000. The vehicle is offered with a Battery-as-a-Service (BaaS) model, starting at ₹10.99 lakh, with an additional charge of ₹3.99 per kilometer for battery usage.

item.title: Fractal Analytics: Premium IPO Faces AI Insourcing Test Amidst Valuation Scrutiny
item.description: Fractal Analytics' recent IPO was met with intense valuation scrutiny, priced at a steep 79x P/E, with QIBs stepping in to bolster subscription numbers amidst tepid retail interest. The company's future growth narrative hinges on justifying this premium valuation against the growing trend of clients developing in-house AI capabilities and potential margin pressures in the competitive AI analytics sector.

item.title: India's Two-Wheeler Market: Demand Bifurcation & Export Surge to Drive FY27
item.description: India's two-wheeler industry is projected to grow 7-9% in fiscal year 2027, surpassing 29 million units. This expansion is propelled by robust export demand and a significant shift towards scooters, which are expected to see double-digit growth, outperforming the mid-single-digit rise anticipated for motorcycles. Despite revenue forecasts of 10-12% growth and stable operating margins, the sector faces headwinds from fluctuating commodity prices and the complex unit economics within the burgeoning electric two-wheeler segment. Key players like Hero MotoCorp and TVS Motor are navigating these trends, with differing P/E ratios reflecting market perceptions.

item.title: Dollar's Dollar Strain: Gold Rises Amidst Fiscal Woes
item.description: The U.S. dollar is under significant pressure, trading near multi-month lows as a result of mounting national debt, projected budget deficits, and global geopolitical uncertainties. This dynamic is fueling a surge in gold prices, with central banks increasingly diversifying reserves away from dollar-denominated assets and toward the precious metal as a hedge against currency volatility and economic instability. Analysts forecast continued strength for gold throughout 2026, driven by these persistent macro factors.

item.title: Infosys Charts AI Course Amidst Sector AI Skepticism
item.description: Infosys reported a 0.6% sequential revenue increase to $5 billion for Q3 FY26, revising its annual guidance upward to 3%-3.5%. CEO Salil Parekh highlighted AI's contribution, now representing 5.5% of revenue and growing robustly. However, the IT sector, including Infosys, faces significant investor apprehension regarding AI's potential to automate core services, leading to a broad market re-evaluation. Infosys aims to navigate this by heavily investing in talent and AI-centric solutions, while its strong balance sheet offers a buffer.

item.title: Gold, Silver Prices Plunge; ETFs Face Broad Sell-Off
item.description: Precious metals futures and ETFs saw steep declines on February 17, 2026, with silver futures experiencing a particularly aggressive sell-off. Gold futures also registered significant losses. This widespread bearish sentiment was reflected across nearly all domestic gold and silver Exchange Traded Funds (ETFs), which reported losses generally between 1% and 4%, indicating a broad market retreat from safe-haven assets.

item.title: BII Exceeds India Climate Target, Fuels EV Bus Expansion
item.description: British International Investment (BII) has surpassed its $1 billion climate finance commitment in India, announcing over $1.1 billion in total investments. A significant portion of this expansion includes a ₹43 crore investment in Turno, an Indian EV battery infrastructure company. This funding will propel Turno's new e-bus division, ElectricGo, facilitating the financing of 34 intercity electric buses across India. BII's strategy aligns with India's net-zero ambitions, supporting clean energy and mobility solutions.

item.title: Fortis Healthcare: Growth Surge Amidst Debt and Valuation Scrutiny
item.description: Fortis Healthcare's hospital division surged 19.4% year-on-year in Q3FY26, fueled by 750 new beds and strategic acquisitions. The company aims to retire INR 25.5 billion in net debt via an equity infusion from promoter IHH. Despite an upgrade to BUY with a INR 1050 target price from ICICI Securities, the market is weighing the sustainability of growth against rising operational costs and the dilutive impact of the proposed debt resolution. Competitors also report strong performance, indicating a positive sector trend but intensifying competition. The valuation at 25x FY28E EV/EBITDA for hospitals warrants close observation of execution and margin stability.

item.title: India's Regulatory Tightening Pressures Netflix in Key Growth Market
item.description: Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw has urged global OTT platforms, including Netflix, to rigorously adhere to India's legal framework and cultural norms. This directive follows the 'Ghooskhor Pandat' controversy and signals increased government oversight. For Netflix, already navigating a price-sensitive market with strong local competition and unique content demands, these regulatory pressures could impact creative autonomy and operational costs, potentially hindering growth in a crucial emerging market.

item.title: Gulshan Polyols Profit Surges 504% Fueled by Ethanol Boom
item.description: Gulshan Polyols Limited reported a stellar Q3 FY26, with profits soaring 504% year-on-year to ₹40.9 crores, propelled by exceptional performance in its ethanol segment. Revenue grew to ₹626.7 crores, and EBITDA surged 211% with margins expanding significantly. The company maintained its FY26 revenue target of ₹2,300 crores and set an ambitious ₹2,600-2,800 crores goal for FY27, focusing on operational efficiencies and future specialty chemical expansion.

item.title: FMCG Q3 FY26: Revenue Jumps 9%, Margins Capped by GST & Competition
item.description: FMCG firms achieved 9% revenue growth in Q3 FY26, boosted by 6% volume increase and GST-related adjustments. However, margin expansion was limited due to price corrections and intense competition. This reliance on external factors raises concerns about sustainable profitability, as highlighted by Systematix Group.

item.title: Indogulf Cropsciences Grows Sales 17%, But Skips Future Guidance
item.description: Indogulf Cropsciences Limited reported a 17% year-on-year revenue increase to ₹116.1 crore in Q3 FY26, with nine-month revenue up 19.3% to ₹553 crore. While EBITDA showed growth, a one-time tax provision impacted net profit. The company avoided providing forward-looking revenue and margin guidance for FY26 and FY27, citing industry volatility.

item.title: Dr. Agarwal's Eye Hospital Merger Gets Nod From BSE, NSE
item.description: Dr. Agarwal's Health Care Limited announced it has received 'no adverse observations' from BSE and 'no objection' from NSE for its proposed amalgamation with Dr. Agarwal’s Eye Hospital Limited. These crucial regulatory approvals clear the path for the company to seek final clearances from the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT), shareholders, and creditors. SEBI has also provided specific conditions that must be met for the merger to proceed.

item.title: BSE Gives Green Signal to Dr. Agarwal's Eye Hospital Merger Scheme
item.description: Dr. Agarwal's Eye Hospital Limited has received a crucial 'no adverse observations' letter from BSE Limited regarding its proposed amalgamation with Dr. Agarwal’s Health Care Limited (AHCL). This marks a significant step forward in the consolidation plan, which aims to streamline operations and create a unified entity. The merger, however, still awaits final approvals from shareholders, creditors, and the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT).

item.title: Jupiter Wagons Profit Surges 38% On Strong Orders, Eyes EV & Passenger Train Growth
item.description: Jupiter Wagons reported a robust Q3 FY26 with a 38% surge in net profit to ₹62 crore, supported by a 13% rise in income and a strong consolidated order book of ₹5,041 crore. While the company anticipates a muted near-term for freight wagons due to supply chain disruptions, it is strategically expanding into high-growth areas like EV battery systems and passenger rolling stock, positioning for significant long-term growth.
